meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes a hissing sound.
meanings.sent1: The snake was a sibilator as it hissed loudly in the grass.
meanings.sent2: The tea kettle acted as a sibilator, releasing steam with a soft hiss.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to be a sibilator, hissing playfully at his friends.
meanings.sent4: The wind through the trees sounded like a sibilator whispering secrets in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The radiator in the old house was a sibilator, filling the room with its gentle hissing.

meanings.sent1: The angry cat would sibilator whenever someone approached it.
meanings.sent2: When the pressure built up, the steam would sibilator out of the valve.
meanings.sent3: The leaky tire seemed to sibilator as the air escaped slowly.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks sibilator in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The chef would sibilator as he poured the hot oil into the pan, creating a delicious aroma.
